summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding a subpoena in the Epstein case. The emails discuss sharing a defense motion and a signed subpoena, with concerns about confidentiality and protective orders. The communication involves multiple law firms and attorneys.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney communicating about sharing a defense motion and subpoena, deferring to government on confidentiality issues.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney requesting a copy of a defense motion seeking issuance of a subpoena.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney sending a signed subpoena to counsel and requesting acknowledgment of receipt.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in an email regarding a subpoena.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in an email attaching a signed subpoena.

persons.name: Patrick Smit
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Christian Everdell regarding a subpoena.

connections.description: Communicating about sharing a defense motion and subpoena, with Pagliuca responding to Burns' request.
Everdell sends a signed subpoena to Smit and other counsel.
Everdell includes Sternheim as a recipient of an email with a signed subpoena.
Both are involved in defense legal team communications regarding subpoena and motion.

events.title: Defense Motion Filed
events.description: A defense motion seeking issuance of a subpoena was prepared, referenced as an attachment in emails.

events.title: Subpoena Sent
events.description: Christian Everdell sends a signed subpoena to counsel including Patrick Smit, Laura Menninger, and Bobbi Sternheim.

events.title: Request for Defense Motion
events.description: Brian Burns requests a copy of the defense motion seeking issuance of a subpoena from defense counsel.

events.title: Unredacted Motion Shared
events.description: An unredacted defense motion is shared with Brian Burns following email discussions about confidentiality.

locations: 250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, New York 10019
keyFacts: The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in 2021 related to the Epstein case, involving subpoenas and defense motions.
Confidentiality and protective orders are a significant concern, with the government designating all productions as confidential.
Multiple law firms are involved: Smith Villazor LLP and Cohen & Gresser LLP.
The correspondence indicates coordination and communication between defense attorneys and other counsel regarding legal documents.
